doc.after: Two forms of mass conscription existed during the Han period. These were civilian conscription (gengzu æ´å) and military conscription (zhengzu æ­£å). In addition to paying their monetary and crop taxes, all peasants of the Western Han period aged between fifteen and fifty-six were required to undertake mandatory conscription duties for one month of each year. These duties were usually fulfilled by work on construction projects.[49]
